page.title: 18HOUSE TYPES
page.content: A typical{Pembrokeshire house}is an attractive stone building, 2up-2down and symmetrical with the front door, hall and stairs in the centre of the house. The walls are often rendered and painted white but occasionally they are left, revealing the local Old Red Sandstone or the grey Shale. The roof is made of slate from N.Wales or the local Rosebush quarry, but some- times is corrugated iron or asbestos. Most of the local farmhouses are of this type and the older properties in all the hamlets and villages. Post-war{council houses}at Waterston contrast with the older buildings in the village. There are{modern dwellings}of all styles in other villages, including a few{ultra-modern,}split-level, archi- tect-designed houses which look out of place in a rural setting. by E.Seal
